titleStmt.title: Letters Patent of Henry VIII Establishing Christ College and Church, Brecon, Wales

listBibl.bibl:
Willis, Browne. _An History of the Mitred Parliamentary Abbies, and Conventual Cathedral Churches_, vol. II (London, 1719), pp. 303-309.
W

Stevens, John. _The History of the antient abbeys, monasteries, hospitals, cathedral and collegiate churches. Being two additional volumes to Sir William Dugdale's Monasticon Anglicanum_ (London, 1722-1723), vol. II, Appendix pp. 372-374 (doc. 464).
S

Jones, Theophilus. _A History of the County of Brecknock_ (Brecknock, 1809; 2nd edn., 1898), Vol. II, Appendix (unpaginated: doc. IX).
J

physDesc.p: Paper: ff iii + 265 pp + ff xi. Cover 25 cm x 37.7 cm; pages 23.5 cm x 36.5 cm; ruled area 17.2 cm x 31.7 cm. Brown soft leather cover, but red soft leather spine; pencil note inside back cover reads “Re-backed & repaired by J. P. Gray May 1972 for £7.50.” Written in one clear hand throughout, similar but not identical to main hand of D, with annotations in the hand of Thomas Baker and one or more others.

provenance.p: Given to St John's College by Bishop Thomas Watson of St Davids (bishop 1687-1699), a benefactor of the College (Yardley, _Menevia Sacra_ pp. 118-19, 384). Written before 1717, when Watson died, and possibly before 1699, when he was deprived of his bishopric, as it my have been difficult for him to acquire it thereafter. Remains in Old Library at St Johns College. Consulted by Yardley in compiling _Menevia Sacra_ (1739-1769); page numbers align with those given in his digest of the statutes (National Library of Wales, SDCh/B/31).

physDesc.p: Paper: ff. ii + 181 pp + ff?. Pages 26.5 cm x 41 cm; writing area 18.4 cm x 36.5 cm. Brown leather cover. Written in one clear hand throughout, similar but not identical to main hand of C, with annotations in one or more other hands.

provenance.p: Note in pen on f. ii r: "It appearing by an Attestation wrote over against the first Page of the Statute-Book of this Cathedral Church [now N.L.W., SDCh/B/22] that in the year 1719 the said Statute-Book was collated by the late Bishop Ottley & the late Mr. Chantor Davies with a much more ancient manuscript of the said Statutes [now British Library, Harley MS 6280], which was attested A[nn]o 1588 by Bishop Middleton, Chantor Huett & c., & which said ancient Copy has ever since been unfortunately missing (which is greatly lamented) or at least was never seen by any of the present members of the Chapter; -Richard Davies Archdeacon of St. Davids & one of the Canons Residentiary of this Church made many Enquiries with various Persons and in various places, in order to the recovering, if possible, the said ancient manuscript: and particularly haveing procured diligent search to be made for that purpose among the Books and Papers of the said late Mr. Chantor Davies, altho' the Book in question could not, upon such serch, be found, yet the present manuscript (containing not only the St. Davids Statutes, but also the Patent of King Henry the Eighth for founding Christ's College in Brecon) being met with among the said Books, was, at the Request of the said Archdeacon, generously made a Present of to the Chantor and Chapter of St. Davids by the Reverend Mr. Richard Davies Master of Arts, Golden Prebendary of this Church [NB he held the preb. of Mathrey, alias the Golden Prebend, form 1723 to his d. in May 1745], on order to be laid up in the Chapter-Chest of this Cathedral, where it is accordingly deposited this 25th day of July in the Year one thousand seven hundred and forty eight by me Richard Davies Archdeacon of St. Davids." [pencil note below:] "Qu. whether this is in the British Museum." Before 14 Dec. 1732, when Precentor (Chantor) John Davies died. Remains in the legal ownership of the Dean and Chapter of St Davids; placed on deposit at National Library of Wales.

physDesc.p: Paper: ff. vi + pp. 278 + ff. xliv (blank). Pages 23 x 36 cm; writing frame 16.4 x 29.6cm. Not ruled. Grey leather cover, apparently by NLW. Written in one clear hand throughout.

provenance.p: Origin unknown. This is the principal copy consulted by Edward Yardley in compiling _Menevia Sacra_. This can be determined by the fact that the page numbers he supplies in his marginal notations (rendered as footnotes in the publication by editor Francis Green) align with the page numbers in this manuscript. Yardley's partial transcript of the Brecon charter on p. 415 of _Menevia Sacra_ references "Ex libro Episcopi Menev., Stat. Menev., p. 269. Compare this with ye same Charter printed in B. Willis, Abb. Vol. ii, p. 304." The document in question begins on p. 269 in this manuscript. More fully, Yardley's digest of the statutes (National Library of Wales, MS SDCh/B/31, not published by Green) has page references throughout, which again align with the page numbers in this manuscript. This is our only indication of this manuscript's date. Yardley began his researches in 1739 and appears to have completed the main substance of _Menevia Sacra_ around the mid-1740s, though he continued to add new members to his lists of canons and dignitaries until the early 1760s (_Menevia Sacra_, p. iv; National Library of Wales, MS. SDCh/B/30). It is likely that he was alredy using this manuscript in the 1740s; the latest possible terminus ante quem is 1769, the year in which Yardley died. Probably before 1746.,

physDesc.p: Paper: pp/ff??. Cover 25cm x 38 cm; pages about 23.5 x 36.5; writing frame 16.5 x 33. Not ruled. Red cover, buckram with leather spine and corners. Written in one clear hand throughout.

provenance.p: Origin unknown. Two letters are pasted in among foreleaves. One from Bishop Adam Ottley (bishop of St Davids 1713-23) mentions borrowing a copy of the Statutes from Robert Harley, 1st Earl of Oxford, though this may in fact refer to the MS that is now Harley 6280, which Ottley used to check National Library of Wales, MS SDCh/B/22 in 1719. The other is from his successor, Richard Smallbrook (bishop of St Davids 1724-1731) in 1729, promising to return to Edward Harley, 2nd Earl of Oxford, a copy of the statutes (either Harley 6280 or this present volume) which he had borrowed to use in a suit in the Court of Arches to oblige canons of St Davids to residence. Harley 6280 was in the hands of Thomas Baker at Cambridge at an unknown date between 1719 and his death in 1740 (Bodleian Library, Willis MS. 38 f. 531r-v), and may not have entered Harley's collection yet. It may be that Harley 1249 was thus the only copy Harley had to lend to Smallbrook at this time. Moreover, Smallbrook would have recognized that Harley 6280 properly belonged to the cathedral chapter, while Harley 1249 bears no marks that it belonged to anyone other than Harley; thanks for a loan with a promise to return a book would make sense if the book was 1249 but not 6280. Probably before 1729.,

msItem.title: Chancery Patent Roll, 33 Henry VIII Part 9
Brecon Charter

physDesc.p: Parchment roll consisting of stitched membranes. Written in abbreviated Latin in the standard Chancery hand used in the Patent Rolls.

provenance.p: Produced by Chancery at the same time as the original Letter Patent, against which it was checked (see note at end of text indicating this). Initially stored in the Rolls Chapel in the Tower of London; moved to the new Public Record Office building in Chancery Lane in the 1850s and thence to the second Public Record Office building in Kew in the 1990s. The Public Record Office became The National Archives in 2003. January, 33 Henry VIII: 1540 (Old Stye) / 1541 (New Style).

body.ab:
Henricus Octavus Dei gratia, Angliae et Francia Rex fidei Defensor Dominus Hiberniae Et in terra Supremu Supremum
Eccliae Ecclesiae Anglicanae
Caput Rex omnibus ad quos præsentes literæ pervenerint & c' salutem.

Cum Collegium de Abergwilly Aberguylly in loco inidoneo existit, ubi nulla occasio hospitalitatis aliis per viros dicti Collegii administrandæ datur ad commodum & utilitatem subditorum nostrorum, in locis dicto Collegio adjacentibus ad grave dampnum dictorum ligiorum ligeorum Legiorum nostrorum.

Cumque etiam domus sive Prioratus Fratrum prædicatorum in oppido nostro de Brecknock Brechnok Brechnock in australibus partibus Walliæ,
cum omnibus et omnimodis messuagiis mesuagiis terris & tenementis bonis rebus necessariis & implementis ad dictum nuper Prioratum spectantibus, in manibus & possessione nostris nostra , jam
existunt existant
, vel & existere deberent,
prætextu doni concessionis
ac sursum redditionis reddiconis
Ricardi Rici
David Davidi nuper Prioris & Conventus ejusdem nuper Prioratus nobis inde factæ; Virtute cujus nos in jure juræ
coronæ nostræ Angliæ de dicto nuper Prioriatu messuagiis mesuagiis terris & tenementis ac
ceteris cæteris
omnibus & singulis præmissis seisiti sumus in Dominico
nostro ut de feodo. in feodo.

Cumque etiam subditi et ligei nostri in dictis partibus australibus Walliæ commorantes conmorantes , summa egestate egestata
oppressi filios suos in bonis literis educare non possunt possint
: Et in dictis partibus australibus Walliæ nullus ludus literarius habetur, per quod non solum & clerici & laici omnis ætatis & conditionis rudes & ignari redduntur, reddenter
tam tem tum
sui officii
erga Deum, quam debitæ suæ obedientiæ erga nos; sed etiam linguæ vulgaris Angliæ
minime periti, sic quod statuta nostra in hujusmodi casu edita & provisa observare nequeunt; & quod debuerunt & tenentur facere secundum formam & effectum dictorum statutorum, intelligere non possunt possint
propter ignorantiam dictæ linguæ Anglicanæ.

Cumque etiam in dicto Collegio de Abergwilly Abergwilli Abergwylly Aberguylly pro Cantatoribus in eodem Collegio stipendia atque sallaria salaria ad summam quinquaginta trium librarum
stirlingorum sterlingorum
annuarum annuatim attingentia providentur. Quæ quidem summa quinquaginta trium librarum in meliores usus potest disponi, utpote in adolescentibus & aliis juvenibus in bonis literis instruendis & quotidiana cotidiana lectura per aliquem virum pium & eruditum dictanda, unde possint possunt veritatem callere & quid Deo & Regi faciendum foret satius possint possunt intelligere, in maximum
commodum comodum
totius populi
nostri
ibidem commoraturi, sicut per relationem dilecti nobis in Christo Willielmi Episcopi Menevensis plenius ac & planius accepimus.

Nos igitur volentes ex intima charitate nostra
qua quam
erga Deum &
cunctum totum tortum populum nostrum gerimus, congruum remedium in hac parte providere, & in multo multos meliores usus quam nunc disponuntur convertere
et transmutare et transmutare
, clare percipientes
quod præmissa omnia & singula melius disponi possunt possint :
Volentesque multum statum
subditorum nostrorum melius consulere, de gratia nostra speciali ac ex certa scientia & mero motu nostris dedimus concessimus & confirmavimus, ac per præsentes damus concedimus & confirmamus præfato Willielmo nunc Episcopo totam illam domum sive Prioratum fratrum
prædicatorum, ac totum solum & fundum, totam illam domum sive Prioratum fratrum Predicatorum ac totum fundum & Solum
præcinctum, & ambitum, dicti nuper Prioratus, ac omnia ædificia, terras et tenementa, redditus reversiones & servitia, messuagia mesuagia , sola, funda, proficua commoditates advantagia et hæreditamenta quæcunque quæcumque , dicto nuper Prioratui quoquo modo quoquomodo spectantia sive pertinentia,
ac etiam acetiam omnia catalla res hustilmenta Hostilmenta necessaria & implementa in dicto nuper Prioratu tempore dissolutionis dissoluconis ejusdem, vel unquam postea existentia, vel ad ab eundem nuper Prioratum aliqualiter spectantia vel pertinentia, cujuscunque cuiuscumque generis vel speciei fuerint, ac in tam amplis modo & forma prout dictus Richardus Ricardus Ric'i David ultimus Prior dictæ nuper domus fratrum prædicatorum predictorum , vel aliquis prædecessorum prædicti Ricardi Richardi
David nuper Prioris ejusdem nuper domus sive Prioratus
dicti nuper Priorat' dicti nuper Prioris ac dicti nuper Prior~ ac
, terras & tenementa, solum, fundum ædificia ac cætera hæreditamenta quæcunque quæcumque , bona
et catalla
res
hustilmenta hostilmenta implementa
et necessaria, dicto nuper Prioratui spectantia vel aliquo modo
pertinentia, ac ad
reversionem reverconem
dicti nuper Prioratus & cæterorum præmissorum quorumcunque quorumcunque
. (*) habuit tenuit aut gavisus fuit, &c.

Ac etiam Acetiam dedimus & concessimus & de gratia nostra de nostra gratia speciali certa scientia & mero motu nostris, damus & concedimus eidem nunc Episcopo & successoribus suis, totum jus nostrum, statum, titulum clameum, possessionem interesse et demandum demand' quæ nos in prædicto nuper Prioratu sive domo fratrum prædicatorum ac cæteris præmissis cum pertinentiis, ac in reversione dicti nuper
Prioratus sive domus fratrum prædicatorum ac cæterorum præmissorum cum omnibus & singulis suis pertinentiis universis, ac in manibus & possessione nostris jam existentibus habemus, seu quovismodo in futurum infuturum habere poterimus, aut hæredes vel successores nostri habere seu aut clamare debent aut poterunt quovismodo quovis modo
in futurum infuturum , jure titulo materia vel causa quibuscunque quibuscunque
juxta omnem juris effectum, ac omnia & omnimodas libertates & franchesias jura & jurisdictiones quæcunque quecumque dicto nuper Prioratui terris vel et
tenementis tementis , vel cæteris hæreditamentis quibuscunque quibuscumque
, sive alicui inde parcellæ quoquo modo quoquomodo spectantia vel pertinentia, adeo plene plane plane & integre prout antedictus Richardus Ricardus Ric'us David nuper Prior Prioratus prædicti aut aliquis prædecessorum suorum nuper
Priorum dicti nuper Prioratus sive domus prædicatorum in jure illius Prioratus dictam
nuper domum sive Prioratum fratrum predicatorum ea nuper Domum sive Prioratum Fratrum Prædicatorum, ac prædicatorum, ac
vel
prædicta bona et catalla, res,
necessaria vel implementa prædicta, vel aliquam partem inde
unquam habuerunt tenuerunt vel gavisi fuerunt, habuit tenuit aut vel
gavisus fuit, aut habere tenere seu gaudere debuerunt vel deberent, debuit
sive deberet, aut et adeo plene & integre prout ea omnia & singula ad manus nostras ratione et
prætextu dissolutionis dicti nuper
Prioratus sive domus devenerunt, seu devenire debuerunt, vel deberent, aut ac alio modo quocunque quocumque in manibus nostris jam existunt vel seu existere debent seu vel deberent.

Habendum, Habendum et tenendum & gaudendum prædictam domum sive prædictum nuper Prioratum, solum, fundum, & præcinctum ejusdem, ac omnia et singula ædificia dicti nuper Prioratus, ac omnia messuagia mesuagia terras et tenementa; redditus reversiones revertiones revertione & servitia, commoditates & proficua, ac cætera hæreditamenta quæcunque quecumque , bona catalla res hustilmenta hustillamenta implementa & necessaria, quæcunque quecumque , ac
cætera
omnia & singula præmissa superius expressa & specificata, cum suis juribus & pertinentiis pertinentum universis, una cum unacum omnibus
& omnimodis proficuis emolumentis et commoditatibus quibuscunque quibuscumque , ad dictum nuper Prioratum spectantibus vel pertinentibus præfato Willielmo Willmo nunc Episcopo Menevensi Meneven'
& successoribus suis in perpetuum imperpetuum tenendum de nobis
et
hæredibus & successoribus nostris per fidelitatem tantum pro omni servitio & exactione quacunque quacumque .

Et ulterius ex speciali gratia gra nostra, certa scientia & mero motu nostris, damus & per præsentes concedimus præfato nunc Episcopo Menevensi
Meneven' et successoribus suis omnes et omnimodos omnes omnes et omnimodes omnes et omnimodas omnia et in omnimod' omnes et omnimod , exitus reventiones & proficua
prædicti dicti nuper Prioratus sive domus fratrum prædicatorum, ac cæterorum omnium & singulorum præmissorum a tempore dissolutionis dicti nuper Prioratus sive domus hucusque, & semper postea emergentia et provenientia. Habendum & percipiendum dictum nuper Prioratum terras & tenementa ac cætera hæreditamenta, redditus reversiones & servitia proficua reventiones & proficua servitia , ac omnia & singula præmissa cum pertinentiis, eidem nunc Episcopo & successoribus suis ex dono nostro
absque compoto seu aliquo alio proinde nobis hæredibus vel successoribus nostris quoquo modo quoquomodo reddendo solvendo vel faciendo.

Et ulterius ex speciali gratia nostra, certa scientia & mero motu nostris, volumus & concedimus pro nobis heredibus et successoribus nostris quoquomodo reddendo solvendo
ac per præsentes damus et concedimus, pro nobis hæredibus & successoribus nostris, præfato Willo Willielmo nunc Episcopo Menevensi Meneven' et successoribus suis dictum Collegium de Abergwilly Abergwylly Alberguylly , ac dictum nuper Prioratum ac unam clausuram terræ quæ que dicitur le close Ymaendny Imaendly y. maendyg y maen dyg , ac omnia terras & tenementa redditus reversiones & servitia, messuagia mesuagia sola funda
proficua commoditates advantagia & hæreditamenta quæcunque quecumque , dicto Collegio ac atque dicto nuper Prioratui, & eorum cuilibet aliquo tempore quoquo modo quoquomodo spectantia sive pertinentia; ac etiam acetiam volumus
& per præsentes concedimus præfato nunc Episcopo quod habeat has literas nostras patentes, sub magno Sigillo nostro
Angliæ debito modo factas et sigillatas, absque fine vel feodo magno vel parvo
in Hanaperio nostro, seu alibi ad usum nostrum
quoquo modo quoquomodo
reddendo solvendo vel faciendo reddend' solvend' vel faciend' reddendum solvendum
vel faciendum
, eo quod expressa mentio meneo
de certitudine aut valore præmissorum, aut de aliis donis
sive seu concessionibus, per nos vel aliquem progenitorum nostrorum præfato nunc Episcopo ante hæc tempora factis in præsentibus minime factis facta fact' existit, aut aliquibus statutis actu ordinatione provisione sive restrictione in contrarium factis editis ordinatis sive provisis, aut alia aliqua aliqua alia re causa vel materia quacunque quacumque in aliquo non obstante.

Insuper noveritis quod nos de gratia nostra speciali certa scientia & mero motu
nostris, volumus & concedimus ac per præsentes licentiam
facultatem
potestatem et authoritatem et auctoritatem auctoritatem , ordinario ac loci illius Diocesano & Patrono fundatori
ac et
Decano dicti Collegii de Abergwilly Alberguylly Abergwylly , damus quod ipsi possunt possint absque aliquibus impetitione vel perturbatione nostri hæredum aut successorum nostrorum vice comitum vice-comitum vicecomitum
justiciariorum escaetorum justitiariorum eschaetorum officiariorum aut ministrorum nostrorum quorumcunque quorumcumque libere & impune dictas annuas quinquaginta tres libras pro stipendiis stipendio dictorum cantatorum, ut præmittitur, assignatas expendendas expendendum in meliorem usum secundum eorum sanas
discretiones convertendas commitendas commitendum , & quod ipsi libere & impune valeant quendam ludum literarium literarum
erigere & fundare apud Brecknock Brechnoke Brechnock Brechnocke
prædictum predict' , ac ipsas quinquaginta tres libras annuas ad sustentationem quorundam quorumdam proborum hominum viz. videlt' .
eruditi ludimagistri Ludi Magistri & pædagogi, lectoris theologiæ
concionatoris, qui apud Brecknock Breknok Brechnock
prædictum praedict' omnibus personis doceri
volentibus in bonis literis erudient erudiant , ac sanctum evangelium cunctis ligeis & fidelibus nostris ibidem pure & sincere gratis et libere elucidabunt, secundum ordinationes & statuta in ea parte per dictum diocesanum & loci illius ordinarium & fundatorem Collegii prædicti de tempore in tempus edenda & constituenda, libere et impune absque impetitione nostri hæredum
aut et successorum nostrorum justiciariorum ministrorum aut et officiariorum quorumcunque quorumcunque
, aliquibus statutis statuto
actibus actubus actu
ordinationibus vel provisionibus ordinatione vel provisione
in contrarium incontrarium factis editis aut provisis, non obstantibus, & absque aliquo ab ipsis Pueris vel eorum parentibus pro educatione eruditione prædictorum adolescentium capiendo vel clamando.

Ac etiam Acetiam de gratia gra' nostra speciali
certa scientia
& mero motu nostris nostro , &
volumus & concedimus per præsentes, quod dictus nuper Prioratus fratrum prædicatorum Collegium Christi de Brecknock Brechnok Brechnock Brechnocke de cætero
nuncupetur, & ab omnibus appelletur; ac pro tali Collegio acceptamus &
reputamus repatamus
per præsentes, & non alio modo neque aliter in posterum imposterum vocari appellari vel nuncupari volumus. Et quod antedictus nunc Episcopus Menevensis Meneven' ac omnes & singuli præbendarii canonici choristæ vicarii, aliive aliique ministri dicti Collegii de Abergwilly Albergully Abergwylly , ac omnes ludi magistri Ludimagistri pædagogi lectores
concionatores ac aliæ personæ quæcunque quecumque ; illic pro tempore existentes & successores sui libere & impune apud prædictum præd oppidum de Brecknock Breknok Brechnock & in
Ecclesia
prædicta præd prædicti nuper Prioratus ac aliis possessionibus terris & tenementis, ac aliis hæreditamentis quibuscunque quibuscumque dicto nuper
Prioratui spectantibus spectantia , & infra ambitum & præcinctum ejusdem nuper Prioratus
spectantibus & infra ambitum & præcinctum ejusdem nuper Prioratus
cohabitare residere recedere
possunt possint et manere
possint . Et quod idem nunc Episcopus Menevensis Menev' & successores sui ad ejus et eorum cujuslibet beneplacitum libere transferre possunt possint dictos residentiarios præbendarios canonicos cannonicos choristas aliosque ministros dicti Collegii de Abergwilly Alberguylly Abergwylly , ad dictum Collegium Christi de Brecknock Brechnok
prædictum predict' pred , atque eos & eorum quemlibet sub pœnis pæna statutorum dicti Collegii de Abergwilly Abergwylly Alberguylly , aliquo tempore ante hac antehac usitatis consuetis specificatis & declaratis, absque impetitione molestatione vel turbatione perturbatione nostri hæredum vel successorum nostrorum,

vicecomitum ballivorum
servientium officiariorum vel ministrorum nostrorum, hæredum aut et successorum nostrorum quorumcunque quorumcumque quorumcunque
, vel eorum alicujus
cohabitare faciat facere.

Et
ulterius ulteius volumus & concedimus per præsentes de speciali gratia gra nostra certa scientia & mero motu nostris, quod idem nunc Episcopus Menevensis Meneven & successores sui, ac omnes alii residentiarii præbendarii canonici vicarii choristæ, aliique ministri dicti Collegii de Abergwilly Alberguylly Abergwylly & successores sui, pure libere quiete et hæreditarie habeant & teneant sibi & successoribus suis in perpetuum imperpetuum , omnia & omnimoda maneria messuagia mesuagia terras & tenementa, redditus reversiones & servitia, advocationes ecclesiarum vicariarum & capellarum, proficua emolumenta commoditates & hæreditamenta, libertates franchesias præheminentias præeminentias præhementias & jura
quæcunque quecumque aliquo modo antehac ante hac data concessa debita vel spectantia dicto Collegio de Abergwilly Alberguylly Abergwylly , vel fabricæ dicti Collegii. Et quod ipse ipsi nunc Episcopus Menevensis Meneven
canonici Cononici
residentiarii præbendarii vicarii choristæ, vel collegiati aliive ministri quicunque quicumque dicti Collegii de Abergwilly Alberguylly Abergwylly , & successores sui, habeant gaudeant & utantur omnibus & omnimodis privilegiis libertatibus franchesiis præheminentiis & juribus quibuscunque quibuscumque
, adeo plene & integre ac et in tam amplis modo & forma, prout ipsi
et prædecessores sui in Collegio de Abergwilly Alberguylly Abergwylly antea habuerunt tenuerunt vel gavisi fuerunt, aut habere tenere gaudere vel uti solebant vel debuerunt, vel eorum aliquis in dicto Collegio de Abergwilly Alberguylly Abergwylly
aliquo tempore præ antea preantea
habuit tenuit vel gavisus fuit, aut habere tenere gaudere vel uti solebat vel debuit, ad opus & usum sustentationis & manutentionis prædicti Collegii Christi de Brecknock Brechnok Brechnock Brechnocke , ac ea omnia & singula præmissa

tenementa ac omnia alia jura commoditates proficua & hæreditamenta quæcunque, quæ aliquo tempore habita cognita accepta acceptata reputata vel

alicui præmissorum aliquo modo appendentia pertinentia sive spectantia. Ex speciali gratia nostra certa scientia & mero motu nostris, damus concedimus & confirmamus per præsentes dicto nunc Episcopo Menevensi
Meneven' , & successoribus suis tam libere & effectualiter bene sufficienter
et
integraliter, ac si omnia & singula præmissa cum suis pertinentiis universis realiter
distincte nominatim specialiter ac certitudinaliter melioribus modis viis & mediis ac clarioribus & efficacioribus terminis verbis atque sententiis, juxta omnem juris effectum, & juxta omnes meliores & maxime sufficientes intelligentias, in lege dictum nuper Prioratum dictus nuper Prioratus Collegium maneria, messuagia mesuagia terras
et
tenementa redditus reversiones & servitia ac cætera hæreditamenta quæcunque quecumque , cum omnibus & singulis suis pertinentiis & commoditatibus universis declarat. dat. explanat. pronunciat. & publicat. declarata data explanata pronunciata et publicata declarata data explanata pronunciata et puplicata fuissent & essent aptissimis verbis utque atque sententiis in lege ad præmiss. præmissa & quamlibet inde parcellam clariss. clarissimam clarissimis
accommodatiss. accommodatissimam accommodatissimis & specialiss. specialissimam specialissimis quæ possunt possint
excogitari. excogitare

Eo quod expressa mentio
de Certitudine
præmissorum aut de aliis donis sive Concessionibus per nos vel per aliquem progenitorum nostrorum præfato Episcopo Meneven' aut alicui Prædecessorum suorum ante hec tempora facta in præsentibus minime factæ existit aut aliquo statuto actu Ordinatione Provisione sive restrictiones in contrarium factis editis ordinatis sive provisis aut aliqua alia re causa vel materia quacunque in aliquo non obstante
&c. .
In cujus rei Testimonium has literas nostras fieri fecimus Patentes. & c'.
Teste meipso T'. R. apud
Westm’ Westmonasterium
decimo nono xix die Januarii , Anno Regni Regis Henrici octavi tricesimo tertio. Anno Regni nostri Tricesimo secundo

Per breve de privato Sigillo & de dat’
præd prædict' &c.
Convenit cum Recordo & Examinat. Per me Humfredum Harris. Convenit cum Recordo & Examinat.

app.rdg: Thomas Bevens. Per me Humfredum Harris.
